intro: Oxypolis teretifolia, commonly known as slender oxypolis, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant features slender, upright stems that are often hairy, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a prominent midrib. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Oxypolis teretifolia is often found in moist soils along stream banks and in open woodlands.
